result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M. Strohkirch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel M. Strohkirch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel M. Strohkirch was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Daniel M. Strohkirch was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Daniel M. Strohkirch was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Daniel M. Strohkirch was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed.  WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Vicki Zick is relieved of further representing Strohkirch in these matters.  WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:08 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
Parties have received copies of PSI and had opportunity to review it. 
No additions/corrections to PSI from the State. 
Atty Morgan states he will address additions/corrections to PSI in his argument. 
VRCW. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 4>9 months MCJ. 
                           : Ct. 9>>5 years Imprisonment - 2 years IC and 3 years ES. 
                           : Ct. 10>>5 years Imprisonment - 2 years IC and 3 years ES. 
                           : Ct. 11>>5 years Imprisonment - 2 years IC and 3 years ES. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES: $156.71 restitution to M.B.; no contact with M.B. or J.S. unless deemed approrpriate by the agent; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior written agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run concurrent to each other. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 140 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Counsel to retain copies of PSI - COURT reminds counsel to keep them confidential. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WI Correctional System. 
Adj: 9:57 am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:02 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Intimidate Victim-Use or Attempt Force/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 2 (Intimidate Victim-Threaten Force, etc/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 3 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 5 (DC/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 6 (Battery/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 7 (DC/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 8 (Perjury-Before Court/Solicitation of)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 12 (Felony BJ)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 13 (Felony BJ)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 14 (Felony BJ)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 4 (Misd. Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 9 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
         : Ct. 10 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
         : Ct. 11 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 6 weeks. 
COURT sets calendar call on 2/3/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set sentencing hearing. 

Atty Morgan requests bond be modified to signature bond. 
Argument. 
COURT denies motion. 

Adj: 9:15 am
and Certificate of Appearance (suboena served on M.M.B. 1/27/16)
and Certificate of Appearance (Subpoena served on J.M.S. 1/22/16)

SIGNATURE BOND MUST BE CO-SIGNED BY ONE OF THE DEFENDANT'S PARENTS BY CLOSE OF BUSINESS ON 4/03/15.  No contact with victim(s):  M.B. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.
